content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 03 Apr 2019What do people mean when they say 'benchmark' and what does it mean to 'beat the market'? ?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Apr 2019There are all kinds of index around the world. For US, 1 example is the S&P 500. For SG, the example is the STI. So a lot of people will compare their returns using a index as a benchmark. So if you were to beat the index that you used as a benchmark, it means that you have successfully beat the market.0 comments0
